page.title: 05POLLUTION AND CONSERVATION
page.content: Pollution is caused by large scale use of chemical fertilizers,especially nitrates & by spraying pesticides and fungicides. Conservation. To cut down on nitrate fertilizing,the dairy farmer is experimenting with Lucerne & Clover growing and uses cattle manure for as much fertilizing as possible.He avoids all fertilization on areas with rare plants & is tree planting in the "dead" corners of fields to achieve a measure of pest control by birds.Another farmer has enlarged old brick clay pits to form small lakes for trout fishing and for water reservoirs. Water life is returning to the area again,with ducks swallows,martins & water plants such as the double marsh marigold. Trees & hedges are left as far as possible to encourage bird nesting.
